questions.1: When does the Rogue Scholar launch?
questions.2: How can I sign up for the Rogue Scholar?
questions.3: Why would the Rogue Scholar not accept my blog?
questions.4: Does the Rogue Scholar accept blogs about scholarship?
questions.5: What languages does the Rogue Scholar support?
questions.6: How does the Rogue Scholar archive my blog?
questions.7: My RSS feed only contains summaries of blog posts.
questions.8: Does the Rogue Scholar support podcasts and vlogs?
questions.9: What does archiving my blog with the Rogue Scholar cost?
questions.10: When do I pay for my posts?
questions.11: What costs are there for users of the Rogue Scholar?
questions.12: Can I sponsor or otherwise support the Rogue Scholar?

answers.1: The Rogue Scholar is available with limited functionality since April 1, 2023, and full functionality (DOI and metadata registration, archiving of full-text content, and full-text search) since July 1, 2023.
answers.2: Fill out the form linked from the homepage. We will add your blog to the Rogue Scholar and notify you within two business days.
answers.3: We only cover blogs that write about science, and where the full-text content is made available via RSS feed and distributed under the terms of the Creative Commons Attribution (CC-BY) license.
answers.4: Yes. We accept blogs about all forms of scholarship. The term “science” is used in the broadest sense.
answers.5: The initial release supports English and German. Additional languages will be added based on user requests.
answers.6: We will harvest your content and metadata using your Atom feed (or feed in other format such as RSS or JSON Feed).
answers.7: You need to provide all content via RSS feed, so that can we implement archiving and full-text search.
answers.8: Podcasts and vlogs are supported, but at an additional cost. Reach out to us via email.
answers.9: The Rogue Scholar is free for the first 50 posts per year. After that, it costs $1 per post.
answers.10: We will send you quarterly invoices for the posts we have archived in the previous three months if there are more than 50 posts per year.
answers.11: The Rogue Scholar is and will always be free to use and reuse, all content is distributed under the terms of the Creative Commons Attribution (CC-BY) license.
answers.12: We appreciate donations and other forms of support. Reach out to us via email.
